column8: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 2. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: stop doing what they are doing.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column10: be ready to stop at the stop sign.

column2: 3. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column8: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

column2: 4. When passing another vehicle, you should:
column4: assume the other vehicle will maintain a constant speed.
column8: check your mirrors and blind spots.
column10: drive at the same speed as the vehicle you are passing.

column4: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 7. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.

column4: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.
column6: an area designated for blind persons.

column2: 10. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column6: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column8: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column10: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.

15. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column4: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.

column6: may cause you to hydroplane even with very little water on the road.

column2: 17. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.
column6: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column8: The other answers are both correct.

column4: should drink coffee to stay awake.
column8: are at risk of being involved in a crash.

column2: 21. If you've had a few beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:

column4: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children
column8: Watch out for children crossing the street

column4: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column10: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 24. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
column6: you are not wearing safety belts.
column8: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.

column2: 25. It is illegal to drive below the speed limit:
column6: when driving slowly disrupts the normal flow of traffic.
